## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**AI Assistant:**
Hey there! I'm here to assist you in understanding Verus. What would you like to know?

**User:**
I'm curious about creating blockchains using the VerusID protocol. What kind of blockchains can be created, and what are their features?

**AI Assistant:**
Using the VerusID protocol, users can create their own full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchains that are 50% POW/50% POS and 51% hash attack resistant. These blockchains can send and receive from the Verus chain that launched them, and they are merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, allowing projects to join the worldwide Verus community and improve the daemon.

**User:**
That sounds interesting! How do blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches work in the Verus ecosystem, and what are their benefits?

**AI Assistant:**
In the Verus ecosystem, blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches allow users to set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in their preferred currencies on-chain. If the minimums are not met by the start time of the blockchain, all participants will automatically get a refund of all contributions. This provides a secure and reliable way to launch new currencies and blockchains, with minimum risk for participants.

**User:**
I've also heard about DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets. What are they, and how do they work in the Verus ecosystem?

**AI Assistant:**
DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets are features of the Verus DeFi protocol that allow ID owners to define currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100%. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers.

**User:**
What are the benefits of launching a blockchain and a liquidity pool simultaneously using the Verus protocol?

**AI Assistant:**
Launching a blockchain and a liquidity pool simultaneously using the Verus protocol allows for a world-class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain to be launched along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool. This provides a seamless and integrated experience, with all fees generated via cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool being earned on the new blockchain, with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain.
What kind of blockchains can be created using the VerusID protocol, and what are their features?

Using the VerusID protocol, users can create their own full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchains that are 50% POW/50% POS and 51% hash attack resistant. These blockchains can send and receive from the Verus chain that launched them, and they are merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols. ## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches - Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain.
